thread.text: My BlackBerry Dtek 60 is running smoothly so I've got to say I'll wait for a new BlackBerry slab next time. I know the Motion is out but I've had slabs like it before and even with Nougat on it I wasn't moved enough to get it the Dtek 60 just flies and that's why I'm going to stick with it for now. Anyone have any Dteks and are happy with it.
had one last year, keyboard fault and poor customer service pushed me to put it back into the box and have a Moto g5+ a far better phone and cheaper.
Thanks for your input.
I've had my dtek 60 for a while now it's a good phone . Only thing that bothers me is no Nougat update as of yet. The tablet I'm using now has received Nougat. That is just sad.
I agree with you the specs should be able to support the update to Nougat they just need to do it.

I just got the Jan. 5 security patch so the updates are still coming even if delayed. I'm still hoping for Nougat but as long as it's working I'll keep at it. C'mon BlackBerry Mobile release the Nougat update please we know the Dtek's can run it. If your no longer committed to the Dtek's then ask Google to do it.

I've had my Dtek60 for 8 months. The battery is it's biggest flaw right now. I got the January update, but still waiting for February, which some people say improves the battery. not holding my breath!!
But I hate to switch to another phone just yet, because the Dtek60 is otherwise excellent. The camera is quite good, the phone is super fast, and I especially love the BlackBerry VKB. I get so frustrated with my iPad keyboard. I keep trying to swipe to erase, or long press for caps!!
BB9000>Q10>Z10>Z30>Z30>Classic>Dtek50>Dtek60
I bought my Dtek 60 outright so after spending that much money I'm not going to toss it I'm going to use it until it dies. Besides it's a good device.
just got the February update on my Dtek60. update went smoothly, keeping mine unless I get an amazing deal on a motion.

Me too I recently got the February security update too. It's great because I didn't have to jump through hoops this time. I'm going to keep the Dtek 60 since it cost so much until it dies. I'll pass on the Motion for now. But it does look good.

I'm a new convert to Blackberry flavored Android. A DTEK50 got me started (I traded for it) and I liked that so much I went after a refurb DTEK60. Bonus for me, I have the VR Headset from an Idol 4S Windows that I sold (buyer wanted a price break for no headset) and the DTEK60 fits it, naturally enough.
Have had the DTEK60 about 3 weeks now. It's great hardware which I knew from the Idol 4S Windows. Camera is improved over the Idol because that one has no camera firmware and the default is to use the Qualcom drivers for camera. Screen res is better too.
Battery endurance ain't as good as I4Swin though...
BB Hub is the only thing that keeps me on Android as it allows me to run Outlook and keep Gmail off the phone for everything except Play services. Otherwise I just can't stand to have Google's hairy eyeballs all over my personal information. They really take advantage and are over the top, IMHO.
All-in-all it's great hardware, nice styling and the BB software touches are light enough and also very functional with the ability to pick and choose which bits you run.
She's a winner.

title: Forwarding text messages to another phone

thread.text: I am used to having my messages from one iPhone forwarded to another via FaceTime. I’m planning on switching to blackberry dtek60 and motion or keyone. That is one of my biggest concerns though. While I know it’s possible to forward calls to another device, how do I do’s it with messages? Would I need an app?

replies.text:
Hey @MB64 😃 This thread doesn't get as much attention as the Samsung as LG threads do. Forwarding a SMS to another device is really simple on the DTEK60 or Blackberry Motion. 
Simply open the default 'Messages' app that comes with the phone. Then Long press on the message you want and hit the little arrow at the top which is pointing to the RIGHT. 
Then select the contact you want to forward the message to 😃 If you have any other questions just tag me with @Matty and I should reply soon. Just busy with exams at the moment so things are a little slower right now. 
Hope this helps.

Just a little perspective on what's the competition like in Canada based on the MSRP.
- DTEK60 (SD820 Lite/4GB/32GB/1440p) is going for $699
- HTC 10 (SD820+/4GB/32GB/1440p) is going for $999
- HTC A9 (SD617/3GB/32GB/1080p) is going for $649*
- Moto Z (SD820+/4GB/64GB/Modular/1440p) is going for $899*
- Sony Xperia X Perf (SD820+/3GB/32GB/No Fingerprint/1080p) is $699
- Samsung Galaxy S7 (SD820+/4GB/32GB/1440p) is $750
- Nexus 6P (SD810v2/3GB/32GB/1440p) is $699
- HTC Google Pixel (SD821/4GB/32GB/1080p) is $899
All prices in*CAD, either fully unlocked direct or month-to-month with a carrier. I left out the Chinese "flagship killers" because while hardware they are comparable, retail availability is a bit tricky and warranty becomes an issue to ship it overseas.

replies.text: SD820 lite? Where is this from?

Great question. There are actually 2 variants of the Snapdragon 820 processor: 
MSM8996 "lite" 
MSM8996 'standard' 
The are a couple key differences.
The first being the GPU Freq. (MHz) which is at
510MHz for the 'lite" 
624MHz for the 'standard. 
The CPU clock speed is also a bit slower. 
1.8 + 1.36for the 'lite"
2.15 + 1.6 for the 'standard' 
When we looking at memory bandwidth (GB/s)
1333*MHz (21.3*GB/s) for the 'Lite"
1866*MHz (29.8*GB/s) for the 'Standard' 
There are a couple more small things but it's basically a watered down 820 with a little less power 
a droid a day keeps the Apple away
Just a moniker I came up with, but just indicating it's not the same 820 as others, as it's underclocked and lower binned.

So i ve had my DTEK60 for about two weeks now and at first the phone seemed pretty good. Now I'm noticing considerable lagging when switching between apps like accessing the hub or trying to play a video from my SD card. Totally stops responding and so far get a system ui not responding. And get this just a week into my new phone I try playing a youtube video thru Google Chrome and the browser stopped responding. Finally when it started responding again I tried again and same bs. So I tried the youtube video app and just as bad. Couldnt play the same video as it wasn't responding! I was like wow ok let's try Firefox. Installed it and it worked. Man does Android suck. Just earlier today I'm trying to play a video and go back it's not responding. Try the back button and nothing so I try the home button and nothing. System blackouts or something and now I'm back at the home screen showing all my apps but the wall paper is black, no time, signal, battery and etc showing. So I do restart.
Since this phone has newer hardware way better processor (quad core vs dual core) and more ram (4 vs 2) than my z30 I would expect this phone running butterly smoother especially with no lagging system not responding this earlyof having the phone. Never had this problem on day 1 or day 20 with my z10 when it was first released or when I upgraded to my z30 back in February of 2014!
I guess its true what they say Android requires high specs just to run decent and that's why it's all about hardware specs for Android phones. BB10 and iOS don't need such high cpu, gpu and ram specs to run their OS's smooth.

replies.text:
Every week or so perform a hard reboot by holding down the power button until the phone switches off.
This will clean up the mess Android makes of itself and restore performance

thread.text: I agree with the last paragraph completely, these issues you speak of sometimes happen with my note5 as well. It can be hard and frustrating to deal with the issues but it's just the package that comes with the Android OS. You are completely right though BB10, IOS and WP10 they don't have these issue so much. They don't need the higher specs to function. Whereas android is a memory hogger...it will hog your memory like no other OS lol. It always happens.
What o/s are you running ?

replies.text:
I'm running Android 6.0.1.
Honestly Android sucks. So not impressed how the phone lags so much and the phone is new. Way better specs than my old z30 but the z30 run much smoother especially in the beginning even though BB10 was still buggy. If it's not the OS not responding it's the apps that are seriously lagging. My friend had the same problem with his note 7 after two weeks that it was lagging. I figured probably bec of Samsung's software like most manufacturers installing so much bloatware. He returned for an iPhone 6 plus and is so much happier. I didn't think I would be experiencing such lagging issues and system not responding like I am. As I said in the beginning of this thread that Android is all about specs. Like the specs this phone has I shouldnt have any lagging not responding issues this early. I shouldnt have to reload /reset to factory defaults or reinstall my apps to fix this. Android may have the customizations over iOS but iOS seriously has the optimization over Android running much smoother on a less spec out phone.

thread.text: I'm due to change my Priv for the Dtek60 tomorrow as I dropped the Priv and this is what they are replacing it with. Will it transfer the data over like normal android phones do ?

Have you looked at the BlackBerry Content Transfer app?
For your Google data (e.g., Google Contacts, Google Calendar, etc.), as long as you log into the new phone with the same Google account, that data should sync if you ask it to. The Setup Wizard should ask you if you want to sync the data during the first-time setup of the phone.
You can try SmartIO App to transfer contacts it does handles contacts duplication too.
Just make sure you export your password keeper to your sd card and import to your new device

I have two main issues to deal with (other than learning Android & losing Remember/Evernote account.)
1. Looking for the best sync software that allows my Outlook (local/desktop not Outlook.com and NO interest in going through Google) to sync one way to the Device?
2. I'm with VZW and while I'd like to stay with them, I am willing to switch to AT&T since the phone is GSM... unless there's a way to stay with VZW with BYOD.
Currently using BB Z30. I have zero interest in iPhone.

I used to do this on my BB10 device, but synced my desktop outlook account with outlook.com Nd it works perfectly, contacts, calender, emails etc, though I set phone NOT to delete mail on server as I manage my mails on my desktop, phone is more for access when away from office

replies.text: Not interested in Outlook.com, but thanks.

I'm sync'ing my DTEK50 with Outlook 2016 on Windows 10 through Outlook.com. Once you get it setup, you can forget about Outlook.com. It works far better than manual updates with Link every did. Everything updates automatically both ways within seconds.

thread.text:
1. You can use Akruto to sync Outlook with your DTEK60 (actually it provides two-way syncing but you can switch to one-way if you want). The software works via Wi-Fi or over the Internet (without cloud).
2. I guess, there’s actually a way for you to stay with Verizon since they have BYOD. See this link.

I did Chat with VZW and they said it has to be CDMA to be compatible with their network, which is what I suspected. 
GSM will not work on Their network.
Of course, when you're out of the country their phones must work on GSM since the rest of world and many in US are GSM - just not the other way around.
Guess I'll head over to AT&T

title: Review of TCL950 (DTEK60's base) from China

thread.text:
Sorry for the link in Chinese only: TCL 950内涵商务旗舰手机评测：平衡兼顾，难得不土豪
Some highlights:Probably mentioned in a lot of places, this has a 1920x1080 screen, not the same as the DTEK60. It'll come with a 2560x1440 screen instead.And of course, BlackBerry's software will replace TCL's, so you can ignore the middle part.Phone can be used upside down, there are earpieces and microphone top and bottom. Probably applies to the DTEK50 as well since they are pretty much the same design.Performance was described as "balanced". There are some benchmarks in pictures.Some warmth has been felt (around 43.3 C) near the camera after running 15 minutes of NBA 2K17. So I'm expecting people and "expert reviewers" running around yelling "ZOMG IT OVERHEATS" like the Priv.Storage is eMMC, NOT UFS 2.0 like most flagships of 2016, so it's a bit slower. Reviewer says it's acceptable in subjective overall performance.Camera samples near the bottom in the article. But should note that this is with TCL's software, BlackBerry's version may have a different tuning. So far night performance actually looks decent.Chinese version comes with both JBL headphones (reviewer didn't like them too much though) and a Quick Charge 2.0 charger. Don't think DTEK60 will come with the headphones, but based on B&H's listing earlier, early orders will come with BlackBerry's QC 2.0 charger as a gift.7

To be honest, most earphones that come with phones are not great. They certainly get the job done but I would invest in $100+ headphones to head a better experience. 
I don't mind if it has the "old" memory. I'm sure it will perform fast enough for most of the customers 
A droid a day keeps the Apple away

replies.text: Ya I got a nice 150 dollar bose headphones. never use the cheap in box ones. Sound difference is astonishing
